frame.name: Committing_crime
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Perpetrator</fen> (generally intentionally) commits a <fen>Crime</fen>, i.e. does something not permitted by the laws of society.
<ex><fex name="Perp">They</fex> <t>perpetrated</t> <fex name="Cr">a felony</fex> <fex name="Means">by substituting a lie for negotiations</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Perp">The suspect</fex> had allegedly <t>committed</t> <fex name="Cr">the crime</fex> <fex name="Purpose">to gain the attention of a female celebrity</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Perpetrator
FE.definition:
<def-root>The individual that commits a <fen>Crime</fen>.
<ex>How can <fex name="Perp">he</fex> <t>commit</t> treason against the King of England in a foreign country , if he is not English?</ex>
<ex><fex name="Perp">He</fex> <t>perpetrated</t> a crime against mother nature.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Crime
FE.definition:
<def-root>An act, generally intentional, that has been formally forbidden by law.
<ex>How can he <t>commit</t> <fex name="Crime">treason</fex> against the King of England in a foreign country , if he is not English?</ex>
<ex>He <t>perpetrated</t> <fex name="Cr">a crime</fex> against mother nature.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>The action that the <fen>Perpetrator</fen> was trying to accomplish in the <fen>Crime</fen>.
<ex>People don't generally <t>perpetrate</t> a felony <fex name="Purp">in order to go to jail</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>A description of secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). It may indicate salient characteristics of the <fen>Perpetrator</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>).
<ex>He <t>committed</t> each crime <fex name="Manner">coldly and deliberately</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition:
<def-root>An action performed by the <fen>Perpetrator</fen> in order to accomplish the <fen>Crime</fen>.
<ex>He <t>perpetrated</t> each heinous act <fex name="Mns">by calculating what would do the most damage and then finding a patsy to do it</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition:
<def-root>A state of affairs that the <fen>Perpetrator</fen> is responding to in their <fen>Crime</fen>.
<ex>Many of the poor <t>commit</t> petty crimes <fex name="exp">because they have no recourse</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>When the <fen>Crime</fen> was committed.
<ex>A murder <t>perpetrated</t> <fex name="Time">at 1:08AM this morning</fex> was not investigated until noon today.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location where the <fen>Crime</fen> occurs.
<ex>We have jurisdiction over crimes <t>committed</t> <fex name="Place">in Woodside County</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Instrument
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Instrument</fen> used in committing the crime. <ex>Most crimes are <t>committed</t> <fex name="Inst">with a firearm</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition:
<def-root>The frequency with which a <fen>Crime</fen> is committed.
<ex>The average serial killer <t>commits</t> a crime <fex name="Freq">every five years</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: commit.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: perpetrate or carry out (a mistake, crime, or immoral act)

lexUnit.name: perpetrate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: carry out or commit (a harmful, illegal, or immoral action).

lexUnit.name: crime.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an action which constitutes a serious offence against an individual or the state and is punishable by law.

lexUnit.name: commission.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the action of committing a crime or offence.
